Andy Coulson one degree of separation to the McCann affair: McCann family spokesman Clarence Mitchell joins CCHQ as head of media monitoring for the election www.prweek.com PR Week has the story: The Conservative Party has signed up Clarence Mitchell , best-known as spokesman for Madeleine McCann's parents, as the head of media monitoring for its general election campaign, PRWeek can exclusively reveal. " Clarence Mitchell joins the Tory comms operation today, reporting directly to director of communications Andy Coulson . Clarence Mitchell , who was the director of the Government's media monitoring unit for two years( 2005-2007) will take a back room role, monitoring the progress of the Tories' campaign in the media. Dakota and former Rick Santorum of Pennsylvania. Mike Pence said this was his first town hall since the Tucson, Ariz., shootings and he always consults with local law enforcement on security at such events. To me the focus is and should remain on public safety. We volunteer for these jobs, but just because someone comes to a town hall meeting, they should never have to be concerned that there's not a reasonable amount of security, he said. He said town hall meetings are "very routine" for him and said he was grateful that everyone came out Monday in the wake of the Tucson shootings. Full Story CNN

being dragged into a decade-long antitrust battle with the EU- in a similar vein to Microsoft's long-running skirmish with the European authorities- he replied: "We certainly want to avoid that."' I think it is in our interests and I would hope in its[ the EU's] interests to do a quick analysis of concerns that have been raised by competitors, hopefully they are minor or they are not correct, and we'll find out and make sure we are operating well within the law and the spirit of the law, Eric Schmidt added. "We understand we play a major role in Europe and we're not denying that. We have a lot of meetings with appropriate government officials." I don't get it

had no legal claim to it. The SCA, which Zahi Hawass heads, said in an email that its request had been approved by both Prime Minister Ahmed Nazif and the Egyptian ministry of culture. This request is a natural consequence of Egypt's long-standing policy of seeking the restitution of all archaeological and historical artefacts that have been taken illicitly out of the country, it said. Zahi Hawass has campaigned to repatriate several pharaonic treasures in recent years, including the Rosetta Stone now in the British Museum. Page looks on during a product launch last February. Mr. Eric Schmidt has been Google's chief executive since July 2001, when he took over the role from Mr. Page. Mr. Page said Eric Schmidt had done an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade. The results speak for themselves. Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects and new products, the company said. The change was announced as the company reported fourth-quarter profit jumped 29%. likely- if Eric Schmidt is not already tied down by a noncompete agreement. Could Eric Schmidt transition from his elder-statesman gig into a bigger role in politics? That's one theory of author Ken Auletta , author of Googled: The End of the World as We Know It. John C, Dvorak also thinks Eric Schmidt could end up in a role with the Obama administration, one that would be good for tech and policy. See Dvorak; s column on Eric Schmidt 's next act
